newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Solvay rallies after breaking resistance.
newsitem.headline: Solvay rallies after breaking resistance.

text.p: Shares in Belgian chemicals company Solvay SA rose 3.3 percent to 20,550 francs on Friday after breaking through technical resistance and boosted by confidence in the pharmaceutical activities of the company and bargain-hunting in Belgian stocks.
"Technically we have passed an important resistance level (of around 19,500) in Solvay shares and everybody is confident of its pharmaceutical operations," said one trader.
"It is only the pharmaceutical part of Solvay that is attracting investors," said trader Damien Crispiels at Bank Degroof.
